Posts.Content: Pongogirlfriend wrote: Does it ever happen just once and then go away?? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Nipple discharge blood? Pongogirlfriend Pongogirlfriend

Posts.Content: Pongogirlfriend wrote: Hello - I am 47 with spontaneous clear/greenish discharge off and on since having kids, and had mammos which reported no mass with certainty.  Ultrasound showed dilated ducts with cysts probably benign.  However, during the second mammos, a small amount of blood was expressed .  Was referred to surgeon who does not want to test a smear but go ahead with a ductogram.  I have heard these can be painful and have a failure rate.  Here are my questions: 1.  Do mammograms ever cause any trauma or blood - never seen it happen before in my life. 2.  I can afford an MRI so does it make more sense to skip over other invasive procedures that might not be conclusive or work and just go right to that. 3. Should I wait 6 months for repeat mammo to see if any blood appears again and do nothing? No breast cancer in my family at all, even generations back. Thank you for your honest opinions :)  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Want MRI, not ductogram but... Pongogirlfriend Pongogirlfriend
